noun.description: A blunt-ended surgical instrument used for exploring a wound or part of the body.

verb.description: Physically explore or examine (something) with the hands or an instrument.
examples: researchers probing the digestive glands of mollusks

origin: Late Middle English (as a noun): from late Latin proba proof (in medieval Latin examination), from Latin probare to test. The verb dates from the mid 17th century.
